intro: Erophila hirtella, commonly known as the hairy erophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Erophila hirtella is a hardy species that thrives in sunny conditions and is sometimes used in native gardens.
